Text:
Thank you very much............. :)
Can you upload Buffy the Vampire Slayer Classic 01, 02 & 03. Please......
Crysis (2011) , Duke Nukem - Glorious Bastard (2011) & Warehouse 13 (2011) all copies.  Please.........
Dude you dropped an awesome bomb this time! Love X-files. Great collection put together. As always my thanks.
Thanks so much for this. I really wanted the 2008-2009 X-files. now if I could only find the mini novels they did for high schoolers back in the day, lol
A question - I have read the Topps comic series, reprinted in the three volume sets, and these. Are there other X-files comics?

BabiesDontNeedSpleens, I started trying to answer your question and it's so complicated I gave up. So you may want to go to Wikipedia and read the The X-Files (comics) article! In short, the Topps series went 41 issues, plus a 1/2 issue, 2 Annuals, 3 Digests, and the original graphic novel "Afterflight." Topps and two different U.K. publishers have released trade paperbacks, but none of them cover that whole series.

Anyway, the Topps comics ran 1995-1998 for about 50 issues or so and DC/Wildstorm 2008-2011 with these 13.

rakib2099, i could not find Buffy the Vampire Slayer Classic 01, 02, 03 but i did share the original issues that they reprint:

http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/7991895/BUFFY_THE_VAMPIRE_SLAYER__amp_ndash__8_selected_issues_%281999-2003%29_R
BabiesDontNeedSpleens, I do have "The X-Files: Skin" an original novel by Ben Mezrich. It came out in '99 or 2000 and it's in PDF format, if you want it.

Skin would be most appreciated, and thanks. 

I started looking up the X-files question as well, and see what you mean about complex. sorry bout that - just love the series.

Thanks for the information, and the upload again. Like you told Black Canary, old comics never die here. I think they just find people who keep loving them.

BabiesDontNeedSpleens, I was a big X-Files fan in high school. I vividly remember an extended preview for the Pilot episode, our dimly-lit living room, the TV set I saw it on. It's etched into my memory, I guess.

Here's the Mezrich X-Files book. http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/7994300/THE_X-FILES_-_SKIN_-_BEN_MEZRICH_%28HarperCollins%29

About love of old comics, I can recall being age 11 at a flea market, the first time I ever bought a back issue. Rifling through the bagged and boarded comics in a long box... 

I also used to love reading the back issue ads in Marvels, and thinking of which ones I would buy if I had the money (or a checking account, lol).

Never would have imagined someday people would have the capability to download every book in the entire damn ad!
i've never seen it, in print or online. it looks awesome though!  http://bayimg.com/eAIFIAaef
